parameters: Please, use the debugger to change the Regular Switches values.
For visual purposes, let's set the Choice Window Characters,
the events that will be inside choices, to be transparent.
- Show/Hide/Enable/Disable rules, are being set by switches.
<Show Any: 130, 131> This is the zero choice
<Show All: 130, 131> This is the first choice
<Hide Any: 132, 133> This is the second choice
<Hide All: 132, 133> This is the third choice
<Enable Any: 134, 135> This is the fourth choice
<Enable All: 134, 135> This is the fifth choice
<Show Any: 130, 131> This is the zero choice
If one of the switches 130 or 131 are on, this choice will show.
<Show All: 130, 131> This is the first choice
If both switches 130 and 131 are on, this choice will show.
<Hide Any: 132, 133> This is the second choice
If one of the switches 132 or 133 are on, this choice will hide.
<Hide All: 132, 133> This is the third choice
If both switches 132 and 133 are on, this choice will hide.
<Enable Any: 134, 135> This is the fourth choice
If one of the switches 134 or 135 are on, this choice will be enabled.
<Enable All: 134, 135> This is the fifth choice
If both switches 134 or 135 are on, this choice will be enabled.
If one of the switches 136 or 137 are on, this choice will be disabled.
If both switches 136 or 137 are on, this choice will be disabled.
- Show/Hide/Enable/Disable rules, are being set by self switches.
Change the Initial Settings > Conditional Operator
to let the plugin look for self switch values to check if a
<ShowAny: A> This is the zero choice
<ShowAll: B> This is the first choice
<HideAny: C> This is the second choice
<HideAll: D> This is the third choice
<EnableAny: E> This is the fourth choice
<EnableAll: F> This is the fifth choice
<ShowAny: A> This is the zero choice
<ShowAll: B> This is the first choice
<HideAny: C> This is the second choice
<HideAll: D> This is the third choice
<EnableAny: E> This is the fourth choice
<EnableAll: F> This is the fifth choice
<DisableAny: G> This is the sixth choice
<DisableAll: H> This is the seventh choice
<DisableAny: G> This is the sixth choice
<DisableAll: H> This is the seventh choice
- Each choice turns on a switch that will reveal the crystals.
Choices can't be empty. So I left a blank space in every choice
pos.easing = "easeInOutQuint" // Too much options. See help file.
- Select Switch: Turns on the same switch every time the player
The Switch 138 activates the parallel event 18
By default, when you change choices, if this switch is not the one
designated by the currently selected choice, it will be turned off.
But, you can deactivate the switch for this event manually, if you want
to stop the parallel event of playing.

This Switch is activated on event 7
-2 IS when you cancel and don't select any choice.
We turn off the switch because we only want to make an action
when the player select another choice.
If you want to keep looping an action, fell free to turn it off
* With Eli message actions, you can center the choices with
escape codes. But, if you don't want to messy your choice texts,
you can use the script below.
- Show/Hide/Enable/Disable rules, are being set by script call.
- Custom disabled text is set on the Default Choice Settings
Is way easier using escape codes like the events on the left.
But just for you to know, there is also this way.
Can do it changing like below:
Or you can do this way, by just inserting the number of the
initial.visibleRows = "default" // Can be "auto" or any number too.
**Text Color only accept Hex(#ffffff) and Name(red) color values.
**Cursor Color only accept RGBA colors: [R, G, B, A]
pos.easing = "linear" // Too much options. See help file.
Change index number to configure for other choices.
